questions.text: The ability to identify all organisational assets and maintain visibility to them
questions.description: Manage a central inventory of all IT assets. Conduct frequent audits to ensure the inventory is up to date. Incorporate network monitoring tools to determine the status of all devices

questions.text: Review/Test and document all new software and major updates
questions.description: Test all new software and major updates before installing on production system. Maintain a detailed history of all installed software and updates and review this frequently

questions.text: An extensive understanding and detailed documentation of all devices connected to the corporate network.
questions.description: This should include the geographical location of each device.

questions.text: Maintain an inventory of all sensitive information stored, processed, or transmitted by the organization's technology systems, including those located on-site or at a remote service provider.
questions.description: Inventory of all data storages, their locations and the type of data kept in each location.

questions.text: Supply chain dependencies are identified and documented.
questions.description: Document manufacture and support information for all devices and software used within the organisation.

questions.text: Services of the organisation are identified, including critical services and acceptable downtimes.
Priority services for the organisation are identified and communicated. Dependencies of services provided by the organisation on other services have also been assessed.
questions.description: Services that are critical for the organisation's operations and services have been identified and documented.

questions.text: Intrinsic dependencies pertaining to the organisation's mission, values, brand image, ethical and moral values are documented and understood.
questions.description: The identification of dependencies that are intrinsic to the organisation's reputation and values.

questions.text: The organization has a proper authentication mechanism for its users and devices, with accounts revoked and managed according to the organisation's policy. Access permission is set according to the principles of least privilege.
questions.description: A quarterly audit of all user accounts is conducted.

questions.text: Remote access to data and assets of the company are managed. Quarterly audit of all access permissions.
Password policies are in place to enforce strong passwords and account lockout is enabled for multiple failed attempts.
questions.description: Passwords are greater than 8 characters and are composed of a combination of numbers, symbols, capital and lower-case letters. Account lockout occurs after 5 unsuccessful attempts.

questions.text: Elevated access or administration access permissions are limited only to selected authorized users. Quarterly audits of all elevated access permissions.
Regular training is provided to users on spam emails and identity theft, including senior executives.
questions.description: Biannual spam training campaigns are conducted and/or annual formal cyber security training.

questions.text: System/network administrators are trained in cyber security. Administrators, users and third-party stakeholders are aware of their roles and responsibilities.
questions.description: Annual cyber security training for system administrive staff is performed, with proof of completion provided.
